    <h2 class="bio-title">Bio</h2>

    <p><em>Nicholas P. Sweeney</em> is the Sir Terry Leahy Fellow of Urban and Regional Economics at Alliance Manchester Business School.</p>

    <p>His research specialises in <em>XXX</em>.</p>

    <p>He joined the University of Manchester in 2025 from the University of Cambridge, after a PhD entitled <em>Devolution and Space in England: Empirical Essays on Economic Growth, Democratic Engagement and Health</em>. The thesis comprised three solo-authored papers, submitted in under three years, and subsequently published in leading journals (<em>Urban Studies</em>, <em>Political Geography</em>, and <em>Social Science &amp; Medicine</em>).</p>

    <p>Nicholas also completed his undergraduate and master’s degrees at the University of Cambridge, specialising in Economic Geography. His earlier academic achievements include a master’s degree with Distinction, including a mark of 87% in Research Methods, and—at undergraduate level—the highest overall marks in his cohort and the award for Best Final-Year Dissertation.</p>

    <p>Outside of academic work, Nicholas has focused on contributing in policy domains, holding positions at the OECD, working on the ASEAN Development Outlook Report 2020–2025 and MillNET_i.</p>

### Research interests
- Devolution and multi-level governance
- Spatial inequalities and local economic development
- Political (dis)engagement in declining places
- High streets, retail diversity, and spatial consumption patterns
- Mobility, access to services, and health inequalities

### Methods
- Causal inference in applied microeconometrics (e.g. difference-in-differences, matching, IV)
- Spatial data and geospatial analysis (QGIS / GIS workflows)
- Reproducible research in **R** and **Python**
